database - h5py¶

class DatabaseWrapper.dbase.Database[source]¶

A class for working with an HDF5 database. Utilizes the h5py library.

AddData2Database(DataName, Data, Parents=None, comp=True)[source]¶

Add numpy data to current database.

Parameters:
  • DataName (str) – name of data being entered.
  • Data (np.array) – data to be entered.
  • GroupName – provide the location in the open database to store the new data.
  • Parents (string or a list of strings) – provide name of parents if they exist.
AddGitVersion(DataName, Action, GitDir=None)[source]¶

Add git version to the database.

Parameters:
  • DataName (str) – name of the neuron that is being altered.
  • Action (str) – description of what is being done to the data.
Returns:

add a child to the git section of database for a given neuron.
CloseDatabase(PRINT=0)[source]¶

Close a database.

Parameters:PRINT (int) –

choose whether to print a message or not. 0 = Yes

1 = No
CreateDatabase(FileName)[source]¶

Create a new HDF5 database.

Parameters:FileName (str) – provide a name for a new HDF5 database. DO NOT include .h5 at the end - h5 suffix is automatically appended.
Returns:creates a new HDF5 database.
CreateGroup(GroupName, Parents=None)[source]¶

Create a group in an HDF5 database.

Parameters:
  • GroupName (str) – provide a name for the group.
  • Parents (string or a list of strings) – provide names of parent nodes if they exist.
Returns:

updates HDF5 database with new group.
DeleteData(DataName, Parents=None, option=0)[source]¶

Remove a neuron from the database. Uses the recursive option to force the node and all of its children to be deleted.

Parameters:
  • NeuronName (str) – name of the neuron you would like to remove.
  • option (int) –

    choose whether to confirm deletion with user.

    0 = yes

    1 = no

deletes neuron and all of its children from the database.

Exists(FILE, Parents=None)[source]¶

Check if a file exists.

Parameters:
  • FILE (str) – pass a file name to see if it exists.
  • parent (string or a list of strings) – parent nodes. Must be a list.
Returns:

True or False
Return type:

bool
GetChildList(FILE=None, Parents='')[source]¶

Get a list of all children for a given node.

Parameters:
  • FILE – file whose children you are interested in.
  • parent (string or a list of strings) – add a parent node before FILE node.
Returns:

list of children for FILE.
Return type:

list

Note

  • currently using eval function.
  • not an especially elegant function.
ImportAllData(DataName, Directory='', GitDirectory=None, progBar=0, verbose=False)[source]¶

This one calls ImportDataFromRiekeLab to load a Rieke lab .mat file or ImportHDF5 to import data from another H5 file depending on the file ending.

ImportDataFromRiekeLab(FileName, DataName)[source]¶

This is the big one for importing data.

Parameters:
  • FileName (str) – name of the file to import.
  • DataName (str) – name of the neuron importing.
Returns:

updated HDF5 database.
ImportHDF5(FileName, Directory='')[source]¶
OpenDatabase(DatabaseName, PRINT=0)[source]¶

Open a specific database.

Parameters:
  • DatabaseName (str) – name of the database to open
  • PRINT (int) –

    select whether to print message or not.

    0 = Yes

    1 = No
OpenMatlabData(FileName, Directory=None)[source]¶

Open matlab data. Just a rapper around scipy.io.loadmat

Parameters:
  • FileName (str) – name of .mat file to open.
  • Directory (str) – directory housing FileName.

Note

This function is basically only used internally. It is called by ImportAllData.

QueryDatabase(DataName, Parents)[source]¶

Query a database.

Parameters:
  • DataName (str) – name of data node
  • Parent (list of strings) – name of parent node(s)
Returns:

result of query in a numpy.array()
getAllFiles(Directory, suffix='.mat', subdirectories=0)[source]¶
getNameList()[source]¶
exception DatabaseWrapper.dbase.DatabaseError(value)[source]¶

A simple class for raising database specific errors.

See here for more on errors: http://docs.python.org/2/tutorial/errors.html

DatabaseWrapper.dbase.getAllFiles(Directory, suffix=None, subdirectories=1)[source]¶

Get a list of path names of all files in a directory.

Parameters:
  • Directory (str) – a directory.
  • suffix (str) – find only files with a specific ending.
  • subdirectories (int) – indicate how deep (# of directories) you would like to search; 0 - 2.
Returns:

a list of path names.
Return type:

list

e.g. subdirectories = 1: Find all files within a directory and its first layer of subdirectories.
